data.current_description: Downloads the complete groov View log in JSON format. Added in groov View R4.2a.
data.summary_suggestion: Download groov View event log as JSON
data.description_suggestion: Downloads the complete groov View event log in JSON format. Returns the full log history as a JSON file. Supports filtering by date range and log level through query parameters. Useful for log analysis, archival, and integration with external systems. Available since groov View R4.2a.

data.current_description: Downloads the complete groov View log. Added in groov View R4.2a.
data.summary_suggestion: Download groov View event log as text
data.description_suggestion: Downloads the complete groov View event log in plain text format. Returns the full log history as a text file suitable for viewing in standard text editors. Supports filtering by date range and log level through query parameters. Useful for quick log review and compatibility with legacy systems. Available since groov View R4.2a.

data.current_description: List devices available in the data store. Authorized for admins and editors.
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves a list of all Data Store devices configured in the groov View project. Requires admin or editor authorization. Returns an array of dataStoreDevice objects containing device identifiers, names, and connection information. Use this to discover available devices before querying their tags.

data.current_description: List tags of the given device. Authorized for admins and editors.
data.summary_suggestion: List tags for a specific device
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves all tags defined for a specific Data Store device. Requires the device ID as a path parameter and admin or editor authorization. data.current_description: Read selected tags from the data store. Authorized for admins and editors.
data.summary_suggestion: Read multiple tag values in one request
data.description_suggestion: Reads current values from multiple selected tags in a single batch operation. Requires a POST request body containing an array of tag IDs to read and admin or editor authorization. Returns an array of tagValue objects with current values for each requested tag. More efficient than individual read operations for multiple tags.
data.reasoning: Missing summary. Description lacks input details (POST body structure) and output format (tagValue objects). data.current_description: Writes a new value to the given tag. Authorized for admins and editors.
data.summary_suggestion: Write a new value to a tag
data.description_suggestion: Writes a new value to a specific Data Store tag. Requires the tag ID as a path parameter, a POST request body containing the new value, and admin or editor authorization. Returns a tagValue object confirming the written value and timestamp. Side effect: Updates the tag's current value in the data store, which may trigger downstream automations or notifications depending on project configuration.
